overview: It was the longest single battle of World War II - Admiral Doenitz's plan to disrupt Allied shipping and logistic lines by churning up the seas with his attacking submarine wolf packs. For nearly six years, his battle of wits against Allied naval commanders almost made him a wizard of submarine warfare. If Hitler had given Doenitz his quota of U-boats, would England had sued for peace?
title: Death of the Wolfpacks
